title: Staggering U.S. Tariffs Begin as Trump Widens Trade War
summary: The duties, which the president announced last week, took effect for about 90 countries just after midnight.

title: Trump’s Higher Tariffs Are Here. Now What?
summary: The president’s trade war entered a new phase on Thursday with hefty levies on scores of countries taking effect, adding further uncertainty.

title: China’s Exports Surged in July as Companies Raced to Beat Trump Tariffs
summary: China is shipping more goods to Southeast Asia and other regions that often re-export them to the United States. China still sells three times as much to the United States as it buys.

title: Four Key Facts About Trump’s New Tariffs, and a Town Hall Showdown
summary: Plus, inside the weight-loss drug wars.

title: For Putin, Trump Summit Is Key to Securing Ukraine Goals
summary: The Russian leader sees direct talks with Trump as essential to achieving his ultimate aims in Ukraine.

title: Trump and Putin to Meet in ‘Coming Days,’ Kremlin Aide Confirms
summary: A summit between President Trump and President Vladimir V. Putin would come as the United States has urged Russia to agree to a cease-fire in Ukraine or face new sanctions.

title: Ukrainians Greet Planned Trump-Putin Summit With Skepticism
summary: Despite longing for an end to Russia’s invasion, few believe that a meeting between President Trump and President Vladimir V. Putin is likely to deliver a peace plan they can accept.

title: Trump Administration Begins to Strip Federal Workers of Union Protections
summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs appeared to be the first agency to begin terminating union contracts, affecting more than 400,000 workers.

title: A Prosecutor Took on MS-13 and Violent Crime. Trump Fired Her Anyway.
summary: Desiree Grace was a casualty of the struggle between the White House and district judges over who would lead the U.S. attorney’s office in New Jersey.

title: Wind and Solar Projects Stall as Trump Cracks Down on Renewables
summary: Federal agencies have recently issued a barrage of restrictions that could halt construction of solar and wind farms on public and private lands.

title: Trump’s Deals With Top Colleges May Give Rich Applicants a Bigger Edge
summary: The public release of data on test scores and race could wind up making wealth even more influential in admissions.

title: Trump’s Redistricting Campaign Tests His Power in the States
summary: The effort by President Trump and his allies is the latest example of them trying to rewrite the rules to squeeze out every possible political advantage.

title: How a Self-Described Wallflower Came to Lead the Texas Democrats’ Walkout
summary: State Representative Gene Wu represents a racially diverse corner of Houston when he’s not defending juveniles in court. The battle over redistricting has pushed him into the national spotlight.

title: Republicans Raise the Pressure on Texas Democrats to End Their Walkout
summary: The political and legal threats against Democrats who left Texas to protest a redrawn political map have gone further and faster than many anticipated.

title: Where the Redistricting Wars Might Go After Texas
summary: Texas Democrats may have bought their party some time with their walkout, but both parties are mobilizing to redraw U.S. House maps ahead of the midterms.

title: The Insider’s Guide to San Francisco’s A.I. Boom
summary: The city is the tech industry’s hub for artificial intelligence, 30 miles north of the home of companies like Meta and Google.

title: Swarming to San Francisco’s A.I. Boom: a New Crop of 20-Something CEOs
summary: Some dropped out of M.I.T., Georgetown and Stanford. Others decided not to go to college. They all say they could not afford to wait to build their own artificial intelligence start-ups.

title: Former F.D.A. Chief Backs Kennedy’s War on Ultraprocessed Food
summary: Dr. David A. Kessler has outlined a legal path for Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to take on the food industry, while testing President Trump’s willingness to do so.

title: Measles Spreads Quickly in Rural Alberta Areas That Resisted Vaccines
summary: The virus is spreading in insular Mennonite communities. But the broader population is vulnerable as vaccine rates have fallen across the Canadian province since the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Americans Are Eating Slightly Less Ultraprocessed Food, C.D.C. Data Shows
summary: Despite the small decline, ultraprocessed foods still make up the majority of the calories people consume.

title: How a Pro-Palestinian Group Fell Foul of a Long Unused U.K. Terrorism Law
summary: The protest group Palestine Action does not promote violence against people. But after it damaged military property, the British government banned it as a terrorist organization.

title: How a Pro-Palestinian Group Got Banned in Britain
summary: Palestine Action, a pro-Palestinian group known for its direct action, was banned as a terrorism group under British law. The decision followed a break-in by the group at Britain’s largest air base, causing a political scandal. Lizzie Dearden, a security reporter, explains how this has large stakes for the legacy of direct action in protest movements in Britain.

title: Netanyahu Weighs Expanding Gaza Military Operation Despite Warnings
summary: The Israeli security cabinet is to discuss the proposal on Thursday. Critics say that extending the offensive would endanger the lives of Israeli hostages and kill more Palestinian civilians.

title: Eddie Palmieri, Latin Music’s Dynamic Innovator, Dies at 88
summary: He roped salsa into conversation with jazz, rock, funk and even modern classical music. “A new world music,” one critic said, “is being born.”

title: Eddie Palmieri’s 13 Essential Songs and Albums
summary: A native son of the Bronx, Palmieri was a crucial innovator in New York’s Afro-Caribbean music history. The pianist, composer and bandleader has died at 88.

title: It Was a Promising Addiction Treatment. Many Patients Never Got It.
summary: How political red tape and a drug company’s thirst for profits limited the reach of a drug that experts believe could have reduced the opioid epidemic’s toll.

title: ‘Fleetwood Mac’ at 50: A Marvel of Serendipity and Perfectionism
summary: The album that turned the band into superstars is getting an anniversary rerelease that shows why it still gleams.

title: Trump’s Trade Representative: Why We Remade the Global Order
summary: Tariffs were an urgent necessity. They’re already working.

title: How I Built My Ruthless Summer Reading List
summary: Whichever books you choose, and however you choose them, may your summer reading be satisfying, and your curating ruthless.

title: Targeting a Vaccine
summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has halted funding for mRNA shots. We explore why.

title: Seth Meyers Won’t Be Distracted by Trump Fiddling on the Roof
summary: Meyers said that if he saw Trump on his roof, he’d assume the president “was pulling a reverse Santa Claus. — you know, going house to house taking toys away from kids.”

title: D.N.C. Pledges $1.5 Million to New Jersey Governor’s Race
summary: The cash infusion is a rare move by the Democratic National Committee in deep-blue New Jersey, where Representative Mikie Sherrill narrowly leads her G.O.P. opponent.

title: Here’s What France’s Largest Wildfire in Decades Looks Like
summary: Prime Minister François Bayrou described the nearly 40,000-acre fire, which has killed one person, as a “catastrophe on an unprecedented scale.”

title: How Ozempic Maker Novo Nordisk Lost Its Shine
summary: The pioneering Danish drugmaker was once the most valuable company in Europe, but analysts say a number of missteps reversed its fortunes.

title: Federal Agents in L.A. Conduct a Big Immigration Raid at a Home Depot
summary: A rented Penske truck was used to ferry agents to the Home Depot where the raid was conducted, days after an appeals court upheld an order limiting some enforcement tactics.
